oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1955-11-19 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 19, 1955. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ernest Tubb (host/performer), guest performers the Carter Sisters with Mother Maybelle (although the Louvin Brothers were advertised as the guests for this week on the previous show), and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Moon Mullican, Minnie Pearl, Grandpa Jones, Tommy Jackson, and Lew Childre. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ernest Tubb; Rod Brasfield; Carter Sisters; Maybelle Carter
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Ernest Tubb -- Thirty Days (To Come Back Home) (Ernest Tubb) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces the Carter Sisters and Mother Maybelle -- Love, Love, Love (Carter Sisters, Mother Maybelle) -- Ernest Tubb talks -- When Jesus Calls (Ernest Tubb) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Ernest Tubb) -- Prince Albert jingle (Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Moon Mullican
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Byrd, Billy; Brasfield, Rod; Jackson, Tommy; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Minnie Pearl; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Mullican, Moon, 1909-1967; Carter Sisters; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Carter, Maybelle, 1909-1978
